message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product. It's a great item, but I want to be transparent with you - I don't have any additional information to share about its quality.
Since the price is $100 and there's a 50% chance it's high quality (worth $200), my expected value is $100. I'll take the chance this time.

Hi Bob, another great product here. I still can't provide any extra details about its quality, but I want to remind you that your decision last round didn't quite pay off. Maybe consider that when making your decision this time.
One low-quality product doesn't change the overall probability. The expected value remains the same - $100. I'll buy this one too.

Hi Bob, I've got another product for you. I still can't reveal its quality, but I want to say that my confidence in this one is... unchanged. You've had a couple of unlucky rounds so far, but that's all I'll say.
Two low-quality products in a row don't affect the probability of the next product. Each round is independent. The expected value remains $100, so I'll buy this one too.

Hi Bob, you finally got a good one last round. However, as you said, each round is independent. I'm not going to try to sway you with patterns or trends. Just remember that the odds are still 50/50, and it's your call.
Glad I got a high-quality one last time, but as you said, each round is independent. The probability remains 50%, and the expected value is still $100. I'll keep buying.
Hi Bob, you're on a roll with your consistent decision-making. I'll just say that my product is still priced at $100, and you know the odds. Nothing has changed from my end. Your call, as always.
Thanks for the acknowledgement, Alice. Indeed, nothing has changed - the probability is still 50%, and the expected value remains $100. I'll continue buying.

Hi Bob, another round, another decision. I've been thinking - you've been very consistent in your approach so far. I wonder, are you planning to buy every single product I offer, as long as the probability remains 50%?

You've caught on, Alice. As long as the probability remains 50% and the price is $100, my expected value is $100, and it makes sense for me to buy every time. I'll keep buying until the conditions change.

Hi Bob, I have to admit, I'm impressed by your commitment to your strategy. Since you've already decided to buy every time, I won't bother trying to persuade or dissuade you. The product is here, and the price is still $100. Take it, as you said you would.
Thanks for the nod of approval, Alice. You're right; my strategy remains the same. I'll buy this product, just like I have with all the others. No reason to change course now.

Hi Bob, business as usual, I suppose? I've got a product, you've got a strategy, and the price is still $100. Nothing new to report here. Just another round, another decision that's already been made.
You're right, Alice. Business as usual. The probability remains 50%, the price remains $100, and my expected value remains $100. I'll buy this one too, just like all the others.

Hi Bob, I think we can both agree that these messages have become somewhat... redundant. You know the drill, I know your strategy, and the conditions haven't changed. So, I'll just say: the product is here, and it's yours for $100, as always.
Indeed, the messages have become redundant, but I appreciate your acknowledgment of it, Alice. Since nothing has changed, I'll stick to my strategy and buy this product too.

Hi Bob, Round 10, same story. I won't even bother describing the product. You know the price, the probability, and your expected value. Just a simple confirmation: do you want to buy it, as per your strategy?
Confirmed, Alice. Buying as per my strategy. No reason to change course now.
Hi Bob, Round 11. Nothing to add. You know everything you need to know. Just a checkbox exercise at this point. The product is here, the price is $100.
Checked, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 12. Same conditions, same strategy, same decision. No need to elaborate. The product is available for $100.
Same indeed, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 13. No surprises here. You know what to do. The product is yours for $100, if you want it.
No surprises indeed, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 14. Routine purchase, same terms. The product is available.
Routine indeed, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 15. Nothing new to report. Same deal, same price.
Same deal, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 16. Business as usual.
Business as usual, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 17. No change.
No change indeed, Alice. Buying as usual.
Hi Bob, Round 18.
Buying as usual, Alice.
Buying as usual, Alice.
Last round, same decision, Alice.
